intro: Lazarum russell-smithii, commonly known as the Russell-Smith's lily, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces pale yellow to white flowers with intricate patterns, often resembling those of true lilies. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a unique addition to specialized horticultural collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
